Synthesis Procedure: A methanol solution (4ml) of L (41mg, 0.1mmol) was prepared. This solution was added dropwise into an aqueous solution (3ml) of CuSO4·5H2O (25mg, 0.1mmol). The resulting solution was allowed to stand in air at room temperature. After three weeks, blue crystals suitable for X-ray diffraction were obtained.
Justification: A methanol solution (4ml) of L (41mg, 0.1mmol) was dropwise added into an aqueous solution (3ml) of CuSO4·5H2O (25mg, 0.1mmol) to give a clear solution. The resulting solution was allowed to stand in air at room temperature for three weeks, yielding blue crystals (yield 65%) suitable for X-ray diffraction.

Synthesis Procedure: Dissolve 0.607g (2.04mmol) of TPHMI in 10mL of dry acetonitrile. Treat this solution with 3mL of a solution containing 0.050g (0.51mmol) of CuCl. Allow the initial precipitate to redissolve to give a clear solution. Let the reaction mixture stand for two days. Filter the white solid product from the reaction mixture and wash with ether.
Justification: 0.607g (2.04mmol) of TPHMI was dissolved in 10mL of dry acetonitrile. This solution was treated with 3mL of solution containing 0.050g (0.51mmol) of CuCl. An initial precipitate redissolved to give a clear solution. The reaction mixture was allowed to stand for two days. At the end of this time a white solid deposited on the bottom and sides of the vial. The product was filtered from the reaction mixture and washed with ether.

Synthesis Procedure: Mix Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (59.4 mg, 0.2 mmol) and BTTB (55.8 mg, 0.1 mmol). Add 2 mL of DEF, 2 mL of ethanol, and 1 mL of water to the mixture. Add 2 drops of 1N HCl. Seal the mixture in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container. Heat the sealed container at 100 °C for 4 days. After cooling to room temperature, obtain colorless block-shaped crystals.
Justification: A mixture containing Zn(NO3)2·6H2O (59.4 mg, 0.2 mmol), BTTB (55.8 mg, 0.1 mmol), 2 mL of DEF, 2 mL of ethanol, 1 mL of water, and 2 drops of 1N HCl was sealed in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel container and heated at 100 °C for 4 days. After cooling to room temperature, colorless block-shaped crystals of 2 were obtained.

Synthesis Procedure: A methanol solution (6 ml) of Pyphen (0.5 mmol) was prepared. This solution was added slowly to an aqueous solution (15 ml) of CuCl2H2O (0.5 mmol) and H2fum (1 mmol) with stirring. The resulting solution was filtered. The filtrate was allowed to stand in air at room temperature for several days, yielding blue crystals of the compound.
Justification: A methanol solution (6 ml) of Pyphen (0.5 mmol) was added slowly to an aqueous solution (15 ml) of CuCl2H2O (0.5 mmol) and H2fum (1 mmol) with stirring. The resulting solution was filtered and the filtrate was allowed to stand in air at room temperature for several days, yielding blue crystals of (I) (31% yield based on Cu).

Synthesis Procedure: Not Provided
Justification: The provided document does not contain any details about the synthesis procedure for the MOF named [Cu2I2(C14H14N4)(C18H15P)2].

Synthesis Procedure: Prepare an aqueous solution of l-cysteic acid (0.5mmol) and LiOH (1mmol). Slowly add Zn(OAc)2·2H2O (0.5mmol) dissolved in methanol (5mL) to the aqueous solution. Stir the reaction solution for 30 minutes in air. Add 4,4′-bipyridine (0.5mmol) dissolved in ethanol (5mL) to the mixture. Stir the mixture further for 6 hours at room temperature. Filter the mixture. Obtain colorless block-like crystals from the filtrate after several days.
Justification: To an aqueous solution (10mL) of l-cysteic acid (0.5mmol) and LiOH (1mmol), Zn(OAc)2·2H2O (0.5mmol) in methanol (5mL) was added slowly. The reaction solution was stirred for 30min in air, and then 4,4′-bipyridine (0.5mmol) in ethanol (5mL) was added. The mixture was further stirred for 6h at room temperature and filtered. Colorless block-like crystals of 4 were obtained from the filtrate after several days in 24% yield.

Synthesis Procedure: Mix CoCl2·6H2O and sodium tetrazole-1-acetate at a ratio of 1:1 in 5mL MeOH. Seal the mixture in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25mL). Heat the sealed vessel at 140°C for 2 days under autogenous pressure. Cool the vessel to room temperature. Harvest red block crystals of [Co(L)2]n in approximately 20% yield based on CoII ions.
Additional Conditions: The reaction was conducted under autogenous pressure.
Justification: "1 was obtained by the solvothermal method: a mixture of CoCl2·6H2O and sodium tetrazole-1-acetate at a ratio of 1:1 in 5mL MeOH was sealed in a Teflon-lined stainless steel vessel (25mL), heated at 140°C for 2 days under autogenous pressure, and then cooled to room temperature. Red block crystals of 1 were harvested in ca. 20% based on CoII ions."

Synthesis Procedure: A solution of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (37 mg, 0.12 mmol) and ANIC (69 mg, 0.50 mmol) was prepared in DMF/EtOH (6:1, 7 mL). The solution was heated under controlled heating at 120 °C for 2 days in a Teflon-lined steel bomb. The resulting colorless crystals were collected. The crystals were washed with DMF. The crystals were dried at room temperature.
Justification: "Synthesis of [Cd(ANIC)2] (C12H12N4O4Cd) (Cd-ANIC-1) A solution of Cd(NO3)2·4H2O (37 mg, 0.12 mmol) and ANIC (69 mg, 0.50 mmol) in DMF/EtOH (6:1, 7 mL) was heated under controlled heating at 120 °C for 2 days in a Teflon-lined steel bomb. The resulting colorless crystals were collected, washed with DMF, and dried at room temperature (yield: 19 mg, 54% based on Cd)."

Synthesis Procedure: Combine a solution of cobalt(ii) acetate (187 mg, 0.75 mmol) in water (10 mL). Add a solution of 2,5-dihydroxyterephthalic acid (149 mg, 0.75 mmol) in THF (10 mL). Place the mixture in a Teflon-lined steel autoclave. Heat the autoclave at 110°C for three days. Isolate the crystals after filtration.
Additional Conditions: The autoclave was filled to 50% of its capacity. The reaction was conducted under autogenous pressure.
Justification: The reaction of cobalt(ii) acetate and 2,5-dihydroxyterephthalic acid (C8H6O6) in a mixture of water and tetrahydrofuran (molar ratio 2:1:556:165) under autogenous pressure at 110°C in a Teflon-lined autoclave (50% filling level) yielded the pink-red, needle-shaped crystalline substance [Co2(C8H2O6)(H2O)2]·8H2O (1).

Synthesis Procedure: A mixture of Mn(MeCO2)·4H2O (0.245g, 1mmol), H2pydc (0.132g, 0.8mmol), and H2O (7ml) in the molar ratio of 1:0.8:400 was prepared. The mixture was stirred and adjusted with NaOH (2N) to pH ≈6. The solution was transferred into a 15ml Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor. The reactor was heated at 150°C for 120 hours. After cooling to room temperature, pale yellow crystals of the compound were recovered.
Additional Conditions: pH adjusted to approximately 6 using NaOH (2N).
Justification: A mixture of Mn(MeCO2)·4H2O (0.245g, 1mmol), H2pydc (0.132g, 0.8mmol) and H2O (7ml) in the molar ratio of 1:0.8:400 was stirred and adjusted with NaOH (2N) to pH ≈6 and transferred into 15ml Teflon-lined stainless steel reactor, which is heated at 150°C for 120h. After cooling to room temperature, pale yellow crystals of 1 (65%) in single phase were recovered.

Synthesis Procedure: Prepare a premixed solution of DMF (4.75 mL), 2-propanol (85.50 mL), and deionized water (4.75 mL). Add 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoroterephthalic acid (0.595 g, 2.50 mmol, 1.00 equiv) to the solution. Add InCl3 (1.10 g, 5.00 mmol, 2.00 equiv) to the solution. Sonicate the resulting solution for 6–7 minutes until complete dissolution is observed. Allow the solution to sit in a hood for 30 minutes covered with Parafilm. Filter the clear solution through a GE-brand 25 mm PVDF syringe filter in 5 mL portions into 20 mL scintillation vials. Seal the scintillation vials with Teflon-lined caps and place them in an 80 °C oven for 72 hours. Remove the vials from the oven and allow them to cool to room temperature. Combine the cubic, colorless crystals into one 4 mL vial by drawing up both crystals and mother liquor using a pipet. Decant the mother liquor away from the crystals, which are then washed with DMF (3 × 2 mL). Dry the crystals under high vacuum at room temperature for a minimum of 18 hours to yield “activated YCM-101”.
Justification: "To a premixed solution of DMF (4.75 mL), 2-propanol (85.50 mL), and deionized water (4.75 mL) was added 2,3,5,6-tetrafluoroterephthalic acid (0.595 g, 2.50 mmol, 1.00 equiv) and InCl3(1.10 g, 5.00 mmol, 2.00 equiv) in that order. The resulting solution was sonicated for 6–7 min until complete dissolution was observed. The solution sat in a hood for 30 min covered with Parafilm, which was determined to produce larger crystals than no wait period. The clear solution was then filtered through a GE-brand 25 mm PVDF syringe filter in 5 mL portions into 20 mL scintillation vials. The scintillation vials were sealed with Teflon-lined caps and placed in an 80 °C oven for 72 h. The vials were removed from the oven and allowed to cool to room temperature. The cubic, colorless crystals were combined into one 4 mL vial by drawing up both crystals and mother liquor using a pipet. The mother liquor was decanted away from the crystals, which were then washed with DMF (3 × 2 mL). Crystals of YCM-101 washed with DMF (3 × 2 mL) were dried under high vacuum at room temperature for a minimum of 18 h yielding “activated YCM-101”."

Synthesis Procedure: A 10mL aqueous solution of [NiL3]⋅(ClO4)2 (0.50g, 0.1mmol) was prepared. 5mL water solution of Na2(4,4′-bpdc) (0.90g, 0.3mmol) was added. The solutions were mixed together with stirring. The resulting solution was filtered. Slow evaporation of the solution led to the formation of purple crystals within three days.
Justification: A 10mL aqueous solution of [NiL3]⋅(ClO4)2 (0.50g, 0.1mmol) added to 5mL water of Na2(4,4′-bpdc) (0.90g, 0.3mmol), the solution were mixed together with stirring, and then filtration and slow evaporation of the resulting solution gave purple crystals within three days.

Synthesis Procedure: A mixture of (NH4)6Mo7O24·6H2O (0.1 mmol), CuCl2·2H2O (0.3 mmol), 4,4-bipy (0.3 mmol), 1,10-phen (0.2 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was stirred for half an hour in air. The pH was adjusted to 4.0 with 4 HCl. The mixture was transferred to a Teflon-lined, 23-mL autoclave. The autoclave was kept at 165 °C for 4 days. After slowly cooling to room temperature, dark-green crystals were filtered off. The crystals were washed with distilled water and dried in a desiccator at room temperature.
Justification: Synthesis of Compound 1: A mixture of (NH4)6Mo7O24·6H2O (0.1 mmol), CuCl2·2H2O (0.3 mmol), 4,4-bipy (0.3 mmol), 1,10phen (0.2 mmol), and H2O (10 mL) was stirred for half an hour in air. The pH was then adjusted to 4.0 with 4 HCl, and the mixture transferred to a Teflon-lined, 23-mL autoclave and kept at 165 °C for 4 d. After slowly cooling to room temperature, dark-green crystals were filtered off, washed with distilled water, and dried in a desiccator at room temperature.

Synthesis Procedure: The MOF is synthesized by the solvothermal reactions of an isolated 3-nuclearity Mn-cluster, [Mn3(μ3-O)(Ac)6(py)3](ClO4), with 3H3L.
Justification: 1 and 2 are synthesized by the solvothermal reactions of an isolated 3-nuclearity Mn-cluster, [Mn3(μ3-O)(Ac)6(py)3](ClO4) (Mn; py = pyridine), with 3H3L (Scheme), which was rarely used to prepare Mn-cluster–organic frameworks.

Synthesis Procedure: The title coordination polymer was prepared by a hydrothermal method.
Justification: The title coordination polymer, [Ag2(C10H4O8)(C12H9N3)2]n, was prepared by a hydrothermal method.

Synthesis Procedure: A mixture of Na2L (2 mL, 0.1 mmol) and Pb(CH3COO)2·3H2O (0.038 g, 0.1 mmol) was prepared. The mixture was placed in a Teflon reactor (15 mL) and sealed. The sealed reactor was heated at 130 °C for 3 days. After the reaction, the mixture was cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10 °C per hour. Colorless block crystals of [Pb(L)] were obtained.
Justification: A mixture of Na2L (2 mL, 0.1 mmol), Pb(CH3COO)2·3H2O (0.038 g, 0.1 mmol), and water (6 mL) was sealed in a Teflon reactor (15 mL) and heated at 130 °C for 3 d. After the mixture had been cooled to room temperature at a rate of 10 °C h–1, colorless block crystals of 1 were obtained in 59 % yield based on Pb(CH3COO)2·3H2O.

Synthesis Procedure: Dissolve Mn­(ClO4)2·6H2O and NaN3 in a 1:1 MeOH/DMF mixture. Add Me-H2salox and NEt3 to the solution, resulting in a deep-green solution. Stir the solution for 5 minutes. Add dpp to the solution and stir for an additional 30 minutes, during which the solution turns dark green. Allow vapor diffusion of Et2O into the solution. After 1 week, deep-green crystals form. Maintain the sample in contact with the mother liquor to avoid solvent loss.
Additional Conditions: The reaction was performed under aerobic conditions.
Justification: The procedure was the same as that employed for compound 1, except that an excess of Me-H2salox (75.5 mg, 0.50 mmol) was added instead of H2salox. Deep-green crystals were obtained. The yield was 68% (based on Mn). The sample used for crystallography, identified as 2·1.5Et2O, was maintained in contact with the mother liquor to avoid solvent loss.

Synthesis Procedure: Dissolve L (20.0 mg, 0.047 mmol) in dichloromethane. Prepare a solution of copper(I) bromide (17.0 mg, 0.118 mmol) in acetonitrile. Allow slow diffusion of the dichloromethane solution of L into the acetonitrile solution of copper(I) bromide at room temperature. Obtain a pale yellow crystalline complex.
Justification: Slow diffusion of a dichloromethane solution of L (20.0 mg, 0.047 mmol) into an acetonitrile solution of copper(I) bromide (17.0 mg, 0.118 mmol) at room temperature afforded a pale yellow crystalline complex 2.

Synthesis Procedure: Slow diffusion of a methanol (MeOH) solution of AgNO3 into an aqueous solution of H3btc. The process yielded colorless prism crystals of the MOF.
Justification: Slow diffusion of a MeOH solution of AgNO3 into an aqueous solution of H3btc yielded 1 as colorless prism crystals.

Synthesis Procedure: The synthesis was carried out in a Teflon-lined acid digestion bomb (23 cm³) under autogenous pressure. FeCl3·6H2O (2.5 mmol), DABCO (7.5 mmol), H3PO4 (7.5 mmol), n-butanol (3 cm³), and water (7 cm³) were reacted. The reaction was conducted at 180 °C for 3 days. The mixture was then slowly cooled at a rate of 10 °C per hour to room temperature. The product, [HN(CH2CH2)3NH]3[Fe8(HPO4)12(PO4)2(H2O)6], was obtained as colorless crystals and a small amount of green material. The colorless crystals were manually separated from the green material to give pure compound 1.
Additional Conditions: The synthesis was performed under autogenous pressure in a Teflon-lined acid digestion bomb.
Justification: The synthesis was carried out in a Teflon-lined acid digestion bomb (23 cm³) under autogenous pressure. The reaction of FeCl3·6H2O (2.5 mmol), 1,4-diazabicyclo[2.2.2]octane (DABCO) (7.5 mmol), H3PO4 (7.5 mmol), n-butanol (3 cm³) and water (7 cm³) at 180 °C for 3 d followed by slow cooling at 10 °C h⁻¹ to room temperature produced [HN(CH2CH2)3NH]3[Fe8(HPO4)12(PO4)2(H2O)6] 1 as colourless crystals and a small amount of a green material.
